title: New GeForce Driver (372.70) or (KB3189031) causing a PVP.Net crash on launch on Windows 10 System.
body:
I received this update today, 20 minutes prior to installing this update and driver update League ran fine.
Now, I receive the crash on launch

Submitted a ticket with all relevant information. Anyone else getting this crash?

replies.body:
Hey there,

Have you tried rolling back your driver to a previous version?

I have, it doesn't work.
I also uninstalled the KB item.... still doesn't work
reinstalled LoL, doesn't work.
Clean install of graphics driver, doesn't work.
These two were the only.... ONLY changes to my system and now LoL is broken.

Same problem here. Can't load the game. After que, bug splat comes on and I can't relaunch the game because of constant crashes. Instaled two different previous drivers and it still didn't work. Reinstalation of both old drivers and league didn't work ether.
Never mind, now that it actually launches, the server doesn't respond. The KB article they link points me to a page on riot the doesn't exist. What the fuck.
A page that doesn't exist? or a page that you're unable to load?

SOLVED - For some retarded reason since that update I now need to run the lollauncher as admin. Think it's time to get away from the outdated Adobe AIR, and just program the clients according to what's needed. So freaking buggy. It's not like they can't afford to make League better and more stable.
